statement.p: A town has a population of 1100 people at time t=0. In each of the following cases, write a formula for the population P, of the town as a function of year t.
(a) The population increases by 90 people per year.
P= people
(b) The population increases by 2 percent a year.
P= people

static.solution:
(a) The function is linear with initial population of 1100 people and slope of 90, so P=1100 +90 t.
(b) This function is exponential with inital population of 1100 and growth rate of 2 percent, so P=1100 (1.02)^t.

statement.p: Let t be time in seconds and let r(t) be the rate, in gallons per second, that water enters a reservoir: r(t)=700 - 30 t.
(a) Evaluate the expression \ r(10) =

(b) Which one of the statements below best describes the physical meaning of the value of r(10) ?
The rate at which the rate of the water entering the reservoir is decreasing when 10 gallons remain in the reservoir.
The rate, in gallons per second, at which the water is entering reservoir after 10 seconds.
How many seconds until the water is entering to reservoir at a rate of 10 gallons per second.
The total amount, in gallons, of water in the reservoir after 10 seconds.
None of the above
(c) For each of the mathematical expressions below, match one of the statements A - E below which best explains its meaning in practical terms.

li.p: The slope of the graph of r(t).
The vertical intercept of the graph of r(t).
How many seconds it takes until there is no longer any water in the reservoir.
The initial amount of water, in gallons, in the reservoir.
The rate at which the rate of water entering the reservoir is decreasing in gallons per second squared.
The average rate, in gallons per second, at which water is flowing out of the reservoir.
The rate, in gallons per second, at which the water is initially entering the reservoir.

statement.p: (d) For 0 \leq t \leq 40, when does the reservoir have the most water?
When t = sec.
(e) For 0 \leq t \leq 40, when does the reservoir have the least water?
When t = sec.
(f) If the domain of r(t) is 0 \leq t \leq 40, what is the range of r(t)?

static.solution:
SOLUTION
(a) r(10) = 700 - 30(10)=400.
(b) r(10) = 400 means water is entering the reservoir at 400 gallons per second at time t = 10 seconds.
(c) The vertical intercept first tells us that at time t = 0 seconds, the water is initially flowing in at the rate of 700 gallons per second.
The horizontal intercept tells us that at 700/30 \approx 23.333 seconds, the flow has stopped.
The slope is -30. This means that the rate at which water enters the reservoir decreases by 30 gallons per second each second. The water is flowing in at a decreasing rate.
(d) The reservoir has more and more water when the rate, r(t), is positive because water is being added. Water is being added until t = 700/30 seconds later when it starts flowing out. This means at t = 700/30, the most water is in the reservoir.
(e) The reservoir has water draining out between t= 700/30 and t= 40, but this amount is not as much as the water that entered between t=0 and t=700/30. Thus, the reservoir had the least amount of water at the beginning when t=0. Remember the function r(t) gives the rate of flow, not the amount of water in the reservoir.
(f) If the domain is specified as 0 \leq t \leq 40 , then the rate varies from 700 gallons per second at t=0 to -500 gallons per second at t=40, so the range is -500 \leq r(t) \leq 700. In interval notation we express the range as \lbrack -500, 700 \rbrack .

statement.p: A report by the US Geological Survey indicates that glaciers in Glacier National Park, Montana, are shrinking. Recent estimates indicate the area covered by glaciers has decreased from over 25.5 \ \mbox{km}^2 in 1850 to about 16.5 \ \mbox{km}^2 in 1995. Let A = f(t) give the area (in square km) t years after 2000, and assume f(t) = 16.2 - 0.062t.

a) Find and explain the meaning of the slope. Which statement best explains its significance?
The area covered by glaciers is decreasing by 62 \ \mbox{m}^2 every year.
The area covered by glaciers is decreasing by 16.2 \ \mbox{km}^2 every year.
The total area covered by glaciers is increasing by 0.062 \ \mbox{km}^2 every year.
The area covered by glaciers is decreasing by 62,000 \ \mbox{m}^2 every year.
The total area covered by glaciers decreased by 16.2 \ \mbox{km}^2 from 1850 to 2000.
None of the above

b) Find and explain the meaning of the A-intercept. Which statement best explains its significance?
The area covered by glaciers in 2000 was 16.2 \ \mbox{km}^2.
The area covered by glaciers is decreasing by 16.2 \ \mbox{km}^2 every year.
The total area covered by glaciers will decrease by 0.062 \ \mbox{km}^2 from 2000 to 2001.
The area covered by glaciers in 2000 was 0.062 \ \mbox{km}^2 .
The total area covered by glaciers decreased by 16.2 \ \mbox{km}^2 from 1850 to 2000.
None of the above

c) For both expressions listed below, enter the letter A-E of the statement which best explains their practical meaning. There are extra, unused statements.
If f(t) = 10, then t is
f( 10 ) is
How much area (in \mbox{km}^2) will be covered by glaciers in 2010.
The number of years after 2000 that the amount of glacier area that has disappeared is 10 \ \mbox{km}^2.
How much area (in \mbox{km}^2) will be covered by glaciers in 10 years.
The amount of glacier area (in \mbox{km}^2) that disappears in 10 years.
The number of years after 2000 that the total area covered by glaciers will be 10 \ \mbox{km}^2.
d) Evaluate f( 10 ) =
e) How much glacier area disappears in 10 years? \mbox{km}^2
f) Solve f(t) = 10 . t = (round your answer to one decimal place)

static.solution:
SOLUTION
a) The slope is m = 0.062, which tells us that the glacier area in the park goes down by 0.062 \ \mbox{km}^2 per year. Since 1 km = 1,000 m, it follows that 1 \ \mbox{km}^2 = 1,000,000 \ \mbox{m}^2. Equivalently, the slope tells us that the glacier area in the park goes down by 62,000 \ \mbox{m}^2 per year.
b) The A-intercept is b = 16.2, which tells us that in the year 2000, the area was 16.2 \ \mbox{km}^2.
c) f( 10 ) is the amount of area in the park covered by glaciers in 2012 (10 years after 2000). f(t) = 10 signifies how many years after 2000 will the area covered by glaciers be 10 \ \mbox{km}^2.
d) We have f( 10 ) = 16.2 - 0.062( 10) = 15.58
e) m = \frac{ \Delta A }{ \Delta t } = -0.062. Letting \Delta t = 10 we have \frac{ \Delta A }{ 10 } = -0.062 , and therefore \Delta A = - 0.62. So about 0.62 \mbox{km}^2 disappear in 10 years.
f) We have 16.2 - 0.062 t = 10, so that - 0.062 t = -6.2, and finally t \approx 100.

statement.p: Find a formula for the linear equation graphed below. You can enlarge the graph by clicking on it.

static.solution:
SOLUTION
Since the function is linear, we can choose any two points (from the graph) to find its formula. We use the form p = b + mh to get the price of an apartment as a function of its height. We use the two points (10, 195000) and (20, 245000). We begin by finding the slope
m = \frac{ \Delta p}{\Delta h} = \frac{245000 - 195000}{20 - 10} = 5000
Next, we substitute a point into our equation using our slope of 5000 dollars per meter of height and solve for b, the p-intercept. We use the point ( 10, 195000): 195000 = b + 5000 \cdot 10 so 145000 = b.
Therefore, p = f(h) = 145000 + 5000 h.

statement.p: Find the equation for the line L (graphed in red) in the figure below. Note the x-coordinate of the point Q is 3, y-coordinate of the point P is 27, and the parabola (graphed in blue) has equation y = x^2 + 3.

static.solution:
SOLUTION
Both P and Q lie on y = x^2 +3 , so their coordinates must satisfy that equation. Point Q has x-coordinate 3, so y = 3^2 + 3 = 12. P has y-coordinate 27, so \begin{aligned} 27 \amp = x^2 + 3, \\ x^2 \amp = 24, \quad\mbox{so} \\ x \amp = \pm \sqrt{24}. \end{aligned} Thus x = - \sqrt{24} because we know from the graph that x \lt 0. Using coordinates of P and Q, we know that
m = \frac{\Delta y}{\Delta x} = \frac{27-12}{- \sqrt{24} - 3} = \frac{15}{- \sqrt{24} - 3}.
Since y = 12 when x = 3, we have y = \left( \frac{15}{- \sqrt{24} - 3} \right) (x-3) + 12.

statement.p: Consider the Quadratic function f(x)= x^2 - 2 x - 24.
Its vertex is (, ).
Its x-intercepts are x = .
Note: If there is more than one answer enter them separated by commas.
Its y-intercept is y = .
Attention: you are allowed to submit your answer two times only for this problem!
Identify the graphs A (blue), B (red) and C (green):
is the graph of the function f(x)=(x-3)^2
is the graph of the function g(x)=(x+6)^2
is the graph of the function h(x)=x^2-3
Find the zeros, if any, of the function y = 5\mathopen{}\left(x-8\right)^{2}-10.
Enter your answer as a comma separated list. If no zeros exist, enter NONE.
The zeros are x =

solution.p: We can solve the equation 5\mathopen{}\left(x-8\right)^{2}-10 = 0 algebraically. \begin{array}{rcl} 5\mathopen{}\left(x-8\right)^{2}-10 \amp = \amp 0 \\ 5(x - 8)^2 \amp = \amp + 10 \\ (x - 8)^2 \amp = \amp + 2 \\ x - 8 \amp = \amp \pm \sqrt{ + 2} \\ x \amp = \amp + 8 \pm \sqrt{ + 2}. \end{array}

statement.p: Find the zero(s) (if any) of the function y = x^2 - 15 x + 50
Enter your answer as a comma separated list. If no real zeros exist, enter NONE .
The zero(s) is/are x =

static.solution:
SOLUTION
To find the zeros, we solve the equation 0 = x^2 - 15 x + 50 . We see that this is factorable, as y = (x - 10)(x - 5). Therefore, the zeros occur where x= 10 and x= 5.

Expand and simplify \displaystyle h(t) = t^2 - t(t-5).
h(t) =
Is the following expression a monomial, binomial, or trinomial?
What is the degree of the expression?

solution.p: This polynomial has three terms \displaystyle{{-12t^{5}}}, \displaystyle{{14t^{9}}}, \displaystyle{{-1t^{4}}}. Since there are three terms, and the variable t in each term has a different exponent, this is a trinomial.
The variable t is raised to the powers 5, 9 and 4 in this polynomial. The degree of the polynomial is the greatest of these powers, degree = 9.

People often expect the terms of a polynomial to be ordered so the exponents appear in descending order (largest to smallest). This convention often makes the polynomial easier to read and avoids confusion. On the right side of the next equation the terms of our polynomial are re-ordered so the exponents appear in descending order. \displaystyle{ {-12t^{5}+14t^{9}-t^{4}}={14t^{9}-12t^{5}-t^{4}} } You may agree that the version on the right side is a little easier to read.

statement.p: Given the table below, find a cubic equation in standard form for g(x).
